title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not describe that the more mutant alleles an individual has, the higher the concentration of cysteine in the urine.
The response describes that the more mutant alleles an individual has, the higher the concentration of cysteine in the urine.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not indicate both of the following.

路 The hypothesis is not supported by the data.

路 While the individual with a single mutant allele for SLC7A9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AA9@ has a higher concentration than the individual with a single mutant allele for SLC3A1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A9D@ , the individual with two mutated SLC7A9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AA9@ alleles does not have a higher concentration than one of the individuals with two mutant SLC3A1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A9D@ alleles.

The response indicates both of the following.

路 The hypothesis is not supported by the data.

路 While the individual with a single mutant allele for SLC7A9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AA9@ has a higher concentration than the individual with a single mutant allele for SLC3A1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A9D@ , the individual with two mutated SLC7A9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AA9@ alleles does not have a higher concentration than one of the individuals with two mutant SLC3A1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A9D@ alleles.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not explain that cysteine builds up in the urine when the transporter proteins are mutated, which suggests that cysteine requires specific channel proteins through which to move, as do most large polar molecules.

The response explains that cysteine builds up in the urine when the transporter proteins are mutated, which suggests that cysteine requires specific channel proteins through which to move, as do most large polar molecules.
